messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Recording Wii games from the TV
messages.msgSnippet: There are many $100 dollar ones I found while googling . Check ebay and your local Craigslist   Alex Polikowsky       ________________________________
messages.messageBody:
There are many $100 dollar ones I found while googling . Check ebay and your local Craigslist

 
Alex Polikowsky
 
 
 


________________________________
From: keeliereader <keeliebean@...>
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Sunday, August 18, 2013 7:20 PM
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] Recording Wii games from the TV



 
Hello,
I know this isn't strictly an unschooling question but I'm struggling to find a way to support this interest and thought I might get some help here.

My five-year old loves watching videos on youtube of gamers. He'd like to make his own videos. I've watched a few tutorials but it makes my head spin. Buying a recording device seems the most straightforward but I don't want to invest $250 at this stage. Can any of you or your kids recommend the easiest, cheapest way to record Wii U games from an HD TV?

Thanks, 


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Recording Wii games from the TV
messages.msgSnippet: A DVR? That is how we do it. I have a DVD player recorder and record while they play. THey used to be very expensive but no longer are.   Alex Polikowsky
messages.messageBody:
A DVR? That is how we do it. I have a DVD player recorder and record while they play. THey used to be very expensive but no longer are.
 
Alex Polikowsky
 
 
 


________________________________
From: sandralynndodd <Sandra@...>
To: AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, August 19, 2013 1:23 AM
Subject: [AlwaysLearning] Re: Recording Wii games from the TV



 
Before people go all technical and off topic, maybe this could be taken to the unschooling gamers list? Or maybe there are links to information. Or maybe the information is that it can't be done, but please keep this off-topicness containes. Thanks!

messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] Recording Wii games from the TV

messages.messageBody:
On Aug 18, 2013, at 8:20 PM, keeliereader wrote:

> He'd like to make his own videos.


Try the My unschooler is interested in ... group on Facebook:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/383815885025681/

You might try searching first since it may have been asked once or twice. If you ask, it's one topic/interest per post.

The Unschooling gamers group Sandra mentioned is:

http://games.groups.yahoo.com/group/unschooling_gamers/

Joyce

[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.messageBody:
Hello,
I know this isn't strictly an unschooling question but I'm struggling to find a way to support this interest and thought I might get some help here.

My five-year old loves watching videos on youtube of gamers. He'd like to make his own videos. I've watched a few tutorials but it makes my head spin. Buying a recording device seems the most straightforward but I don't want to invest $250 at this stage. Can any of you or your kids recommend the easiest, cheapest way to record Wii U games from an HD TV?

Thanks,
Keelie
